Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Ask the player which the floor they want to go to, 
 :       : and store the difference between it and the current 
 :       : floor in Game Variable 11.
 :       : This difference determines which wall animation is 
 :       : played, as well as how many times it is played.
@>Script: numfloors = 4
@>Script: current_floor = numfloors - pbGet(10)
:       : new_floor = pbMessage(
:       :    _I("Which floor do you want?"),
:       :    [_I("4F"),_I("3F"),
:       :    _I("2F"),_I("1F"),_I("Exit")],
:       :    numfloors + 1, nil, current_floor)
:       : pbSet(11, numfloors - new_floor)
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0011: Elevator new floor] == 0
 @>Comment: Choice was cancelled or chose the current floor.
 @>
: Else
 @>Label: Start
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0011: Elevator new floor] > Variable [0010: Elevator current floor]
  @>Comment: Go up.
  @>Screen Shake: 4, 9, @12
  @>Set Move Route: [Wall left]
   :              : $>Turn Left
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Right
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Down
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Left
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Left
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Right
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Down
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  @>Set Move Route: [Wall right]
   :              : $>Turn Left
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Right
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Down
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Right
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Down
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Control Variables: [0010: Elevator current floor] += 1
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0011: Elevator new floor] < Variable [0010: Elevator current floor]
  @>Comment: Go down.
  @>Screen Shake: 4, 9, @12
  @>Set Move Route: [Wall left]
   :              : $>Turn Right
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Left
   :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
   :              : $>Turn Down

@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 4
 @>Transfer Player:[208: Selago Town], (007,005), No Fade
 @>
: Else
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 3
  @>Transfer Player:[206: Koromiko Cave], (007,005), No Fade
  @>
 : Else
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 2
   @>Transfer Player:[205: Route 9], (007,005), No Fade
   @>
  : Else
   @>Transfer Player:[204: Route 9], (007,005), No Fade
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End

 @>

 @>

Page #1
Conditions

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Show Animation: [Assistant], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Text: \bHello! Welcome to PRF, short for "Plum's Research Facility".
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Up
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Label: 0
@>Text: \bHow can we help you?
@>Show Choices: What is this building?, What is it you do?, I'm looking for Plum
(When Cancel: Choice 3)
: When [What is this building?]
 @>Text: \bThis is Plum's Research Facility, founded by Peskan's own Professor Plum!
 @>Text: \bWe've only been active for 2 years, but we're making a lot of progress.
 @>Text: \bAnyways...
 @>Jump to Label: 0
 @>
: When [What is it you do?]
 @>Text: \bWe here at PRF are doing progressive research on Pokémon forms and how it affects their genetics.
 @>Text: \bThis may help future technology and the overall advancement of human and Pokémonkind.
 @>Text: \bAnyways...
 @>Jump to Label: 0
 @>
: When [I'm looking for Plum]
 @>Show Animation: [Assistant], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Show Animation: [Assistant 2], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Set Move Route: [Assistant 2]
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Wait: 14 frame(s)
 @>Text: \bErm... I'm sorry, but I am not allowed to give away any information regarding Professor Plum's whereabouts.
 @>Set Move Route: [Assistant 2]
  :              : $>Move Right
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Set Move Route: [Assistant]
  :              : $>Turn Left
 @>Show Animation: [Assistant], [Thinking bubble]
 @>Show Animation: [Assistant 2], [Thinking bubble]
 @>Wait: 24 frame(s)
 @>Text: \bHmmm...
 @>Set Move Route: [Assistant 2]
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Set Move Route: [Assistant]
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Text: \bWait, you're helping out Professor Apricot?
 @>Text: \bI see...\nMaybe lead with that in the future...
 @>Text: \bAnyways, Professor Plum is currently out towards his lab in \rCeltic Town\b.
 @>Text: \bIf you're unfamiliar with South Peskan, it's through Route 4 on the west, which would lead you to Route 1.
 @>Text: \bAfter that, it's just a small amount south, and you're in Celtic Town!
 @>Text: \bI heard he's getting some of his old research on this special Pokéball variant.
 @>Text: \bIf you need anything else, feel free to ask us. We can help you with your Pokédex research, and also provide tools to revive old fossils.
 @>Text: \bGood luck on your journey.
 @>Control Switches: [0066: First Catching Mission ] = ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>

@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \bDid you hear that the Pokémon called Spiritomb is unique here in Peskan?
 @>Text: \bApparently, Spiritomb lives in an Odd Keystone, and the Peskan one seems to be different from the others.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: vHI(:ODDKEYSTONE)
  @>Show Animation: This event, [Exclaim bubble]
  @>Wait: 14 frame(s)
  @>Text: \bOh, you happen to have the Odd Keystone?
  @>Text: \bWill you let me see it for a second?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Text: \bAh! I see, it was not active yet. Here you go! I activated Spiritomb for you.
   @>Script: pbAddPokemon(:SPIRITOMB_1,30)
   :       : vDI(:ODDKEYSTONE)
   @>Text: \bThat's really exciting. Good luck with your Spiritomb!
   @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @10
   @>Wait: 16 frame(s)
   @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
   @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @10
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: \bThat's unfortunate, I was really curious.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 017
Event Name: Fossil reviver
(X,Y): (035,009)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC_054_Scientist_M

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: The fossil reviver finishes reviving the Pokémon as 
 :       : soon as you step out of the door. See the exit event 
 :       : on this map.
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch B == OFF
 @>Text: \bOh, hello. I'm a scientist.
 @>Text: \bI can turn fossils into living, breathing Pokémon!
 @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: \bAiyah! You come again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \bDo you have a fossil for me?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \bWhich fossil do you want me to revive?
 @>Script: pbChooseFossil(9)
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(9).nil?
  @>Comment: Player didn't choose a fossil.
  @>Text: \bLet me know when you want me to revive a 
   :    : fossil for you.
  @>
 : Else
  @>Comment: Player chose a fossil.
  @>Script: $bag.remove(pbGet(9))
  @>Script: data = GameData::Item.get(pbGet(9))
  :       : pbSet(3, data.name)
  @>Text: \bOkay. I'll see if I can revive your \v[3].
  @>Text: \bCome back later.
  @>Comment: Convert fossil into species now.
  @>Script: conversion_hash = {
  :       :   :HELIXFOSSIL => :OMANYTE,
  :       :   :DOMEFOSSIL  => :KABUTO,
  :       :   :OLDAMBER    => :AERODACTYL,
  :       :   :ROOTFOSSIL  => :LILEEP,
  :       :   :CLAWFOSSIL  => :ANORITH,
  :       :   :SKULLFOSSIL => :CRANIDOS,
  :       :   :ARMORFOSSIL => :SHIELDON
  :       : }
  @>Script: conversion_hash.merge!({
  :       :   :COVERFOSSIL => :TIRTOUGA,
  :       :   :PLUMEFOSSIL => :ARCHEN,
  :       :   :JAWFOSSIL   => :TYRUNT,
  :       :   :SAILFOSSIL  => :AMAURA
  :       : })
  @>Script: item = pbGet(9)
  :       : species = conversion_hash[item]
  :       : pkmn = Pokemon.new(species,1)
  :       : pkmn.shiny = true if rand(10)==1
  :       : pkmn.happiness = 240
  :       : pkmn.iv[:HP] = 31; pkmn.iv[:ATTACK] = 31; pkmn.iv[:DEFENSE] = 31; pkmn.iv[:SPECIAL_ATTACK] = 31
  :       : pkmn.iv
  :       : [:SPECIAL_DEFENSE] = 31; pkmn.iv[:SPEED] = 31
  :       : pkmn.poke_ball = :REVIVALBALL
  :       : pkmn.calc_stats
  :       : pbSet(9, pkmn)
  @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
  @>Control Switches: [0013: Fossil revival in progress] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Comment: Player doesn't want to choose a fossil.
 @>Text: \bI'll be here if you want my help.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Graphic: NPC_054_Scientist_M

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[9] != nil
 @>Script: data = GameData::Species.get(
 :       :   pbGet(9).species).name
 :       : pbSet(3, data)
 @>Text: \bWhere have you been? I've finished reviving your
  :    : fossil.
 @>Text: \bIt was \v[3] like I thought.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddToParty(pbGet(9))
  @>Control Variables: [0009: Fossil being revived] = 0
  @>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \bYou have no room left. Make room, then come see 
   :    : me.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Comment: This only happens when the fossil reviver is given an 
  :       : item that couldn't be turned into a species on page 1.
 @>Comment: This should never happen. If it does, there is a 
  :       : mistake in the conversion_hash on page 1, namely 
  :       : that it doesn't contain a "fossil => species" pair for 
  :       : the item given to the fossil reviver.
 @>Text: \bI managed to revive your fossil.
 @>Text: \bHowever, what I brought back didn't live long...\1 
  :    : fortunately.
 @>Text: \bSorry.
 @>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
 @>
: Branch End
@>

@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-20,-20,-20,0), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \pgVery long ago, a man lived on the region of Peskan.
 @>Text: \pgThe man was curious about the Pokémon of the region, and went on a journey.
 @>Text: \pgHe met all sorts of Pokémon. In the mountains he met Slugma, a lava based fire type. It's very dangerous to touch, but are very friendly.
 @>Text: \pgIn the seas of Peskan he met Dratini, a very elegant yet powerful dragon type.
 @>Text: \pgBut his most important encounter, was a young Swinub he met during the winter.
 @>Text: \pgSwinub was very hot to the touch, a bad sign for any Ice type Pokémon.
 @>Text: \pgThe man was curious as to how a young Swinub could get hot. But then he realized, it was not just the young Swinub.
 @>Text: \pgPiloswine, Sneasel, Spheal, all the Ice type Pokémon were getting warm. Even the snow was starting to melt.
 @>Text: \pgApparently, during the 30 years that the man had journeyed the region. The rest of civilization was ruining the environment.
 @>Text: \pgBecause of civilization their pollution, earth was starting to warm up. Which was making all the Ice type Pokémon very sick.
 @>Text: \pgBut that is when the man met a very special Pokémon. A little yellow star Pokémon, Jirachi.
 @>Text: \pgJirachi granted the man one wish, any wish.
 @>Text: \pgThe man could have wished for his personal gain. He could have wished for immortality, money or fame.
 @>Text: \pgBut the selfless man his wish to Jirachi was to keep the habitat of the Ice types in a permanent state of winter, in order to heal the Ice types.
 @>Text: \pgBecause of his selfless act, the locals dubbed him the Great Anakiwa, and made him a legend.
 @>Text: \pgThe man, Jirachi and the Ice types lived happily ever after.
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\PN]\pgI suppose Anakiwa City was named after this "Great Anakiwa'.
 @>

 @>
: Branch End
@>Play SE: 'GUI storage put down', 80, 100
@>Text: You put the book back.

 @>Text: \pgApparently, during the 30 years that the man had journeyed the region. The rest of civilization was ruining the environment.

 @>Text: \pgJirachi granted the man one wish, any wish.
 @>Text: \pgThe man could have wished for his personal gain. He could have wished for immortality, money or fame.

 @>Text: \pgSomewhere hidden to the north of the Johto region, there is said to be these ruins, called the Sinjoh Ruins.

 @>Text: \pgPalkia, who rules over Space;

 @>Text: \pgAbout Time, Dialga had one purpose: to make sure that Time flows in a single direction throughout all of Space and Reality.
 @>Text: \pgAll seemed to go well, until Giratina tried to dethrone their maker, which led to Giratina being banished to another realm.
 @>Text: \pgThis caused a great disturbance in both Space and Time.
 @>Text: \pgLuckily, for Palkia, it was able to contain it.
 @>Text: \pgDialga was not so lucky, and, as time rippled and bent through the universe, a new creature was born.
 @>Text: \pgA Pokémon called 'Celebi'.
 @>Text: \pgBorn from the disturbance of time, it gained the ability to hop across it.
 @>Text: \pgIt is said that ever since that day, Dialga has tried its best to get Celebi in order to set time right again.
 @>Text: \pgSinnoh, billions of years later.
 @>Text: \pgA middleaged man called Cyrus summons the creation trio in order to create a new universe.
 @>Text: \pgIt is unknown whether he was successful, but his accomplices have yet to give any information on the topic.
 @>Text: \pgThe region's former champion Cynthia, however, did come out with a statement about how insane the experience with the three deities was.
 @>Text: \pg"Any space between reality and time, and reality between space and time and any time between space and reality. It changes you."
 @>Text: \pgDuring that time, Celebi might have seen an opportunity.
 @>Text: \pgJohto, 2 days after the disappearance of Cyrus.
 @>Text: \pgCelebi is discovered in the Ilex Forest, as it took the 'to-be champion' of Johto back in time, rippling space-time.
 @>Text: \pgThey describe the experience as "mind warping".
 @>Text: \pgCelebi has been spotted over the span of 200 years in the Peskan Region, but it has not been claimed to take any other 'victims' back in time.

 @>Text: \pgPokémon, as many know, differ in rarity in the wild.
 @>Text: \pgYou're not going to find a Magcargo type in the middle of the sea, nor are you going to find a Politoed in a volcano.
 @>Text: \pgBut there are Pokémon that appear in low frequencies in uncommon places.
 @>Text: \pgSuch Pokémon we call 'Rare Pokémon'.
 @>Text: \pgBut they are not just bound by their species. Pokémon of all kinds can be rare.
 @>Text: \pgThese rarities may include things such as shininess, hidden abilities, unique formes or even in some cases a specific gender.
 @>Text: \pgPokémon such as Combee are frequently male, making a female one fairly rare, and this is enhanced by the fact that only female Combee can evolve into 
  :    : Vespiquen.
 @>Text: \pgUnique formes in the other hand depend on the species.
 @>Text: \pgSuch as the Buizel in Peskan, which is really rare in other parts of the world, thus making Peskan Buizel very unique.
 @>Text: \pgShinies on the other hand has been reported to appear in every species of Pokémon, shininess only affects the appearance of the Pokémon.
 @>Text: \pgBut because they appear super infrequently, roughly 0.64%, they are often sought after by so called 'Shiny Hunters'.
 @>Text: \pgAnother case of something that appears in all reported species are 'Hidden Abilities'.
 @>Text: \pgThough not confirmed, most recorded species of Pokémon have been reported to have a chance of appearing with a hidden ability.
 @>Text: \pgIn fact it is estimated to appear in roughly 1/10 wild Pokémon.
 @>Text: \pgHidden Abilities can range from a Bidoof with Moody, to more intense abilities like Shuckle with Contrast.
 @>Text: \pgOne of the most well known 'Rarest Pokémon' would be the Pokémon Spinda.
 @>Text: \pgSpecifically one that has its hidden ability, has a specific pattern and also is shiny.
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\PN]\pgFinding a rare Pokémon like this would be super cool!
 @>
: When [No]
 @>
: Branch End
@>Play SE: 'GUI storage put down', 80, 100
@>Text: You put the book back.

Event ID: 004
Event Name: size(2,1)
(X,Y): (006,005)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[\PN]\pgThere's a book in here called "Space, Time, Reality, but mostly Time". Should I read it?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-20,-20,-20,0), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \pgThis book is based around the idea of manipulating the laws of nature, and those who have attempted it in the past.
 @>Text: \pgBut before that, we need to understand the three legends of creation.
 @>Text: \pgFor simplicity's sake, we will give you the short version.
 @>Text: \pgSomewhere hidden to the north of the Johto region, there is said to be these ruins, called the Sinjoh Ruins.
 @>Text: \pgThey say the entire universe was made from this location by the deity that was once called 'The Great Sinnoh'.
 @>Text: \pgIn order to keep everything stable, it created 3 other deities, each ruling one aspect of the universe:
 @>Text: \pgGiratina, who rules over Reality;
 @>Text: \pgPalkia, who rules over Space;
 @>Text: \pgand our prime target, Dialga, the ruler of Time.
 @>Text: \pgAbout Time, Dialga had one purpose: to make sure that Time flows in a single direction throughout all of Space and Reality.
 @>Text: \pgAll seemed to go well, until Giratina tried to dethrone their maker, which led to Giratina being banished to another realm.
 @>Text: \pgThis caused a great disturbance in both Space and Time.
 @>Text: \pgLuckily, for Palkia, it was able to contain it.
 @>Text: \pgDialga was not so lucky, and, as time rippled and bent through the universe, a new creature was born.
 @>Text: \pgA Pokémon called 'Celebi'.
 @>Text: \pgBorn from the disturbance of time, it gained the ability to hop across it.
 @>Text: \pgIt is said that ever since that day, Dialga has tried its best to get Celebi in order to set time right again.
 @>Text: \pgSinnoh, billions of years later.
 @>Text: \pgA middleaged man called Cyrus summons the creation trio in order to create a new universe.
 @>Text: \pgIt is unknown whether he was successful, but his accomplices have yet to give any information on the topic.
 @>Text: \pgThe region's former champion Cynthia, however, did come out with a statement about how insane the experience with the three deities was.
 @>Text: \pg"Any space between reality and time, and reality between space and time and any time between space and reality. It changes you."
 @>Text: \pgDuring that time, Celebi might have seen an opportunity.
 @>Text: \pgJohto, 2 days after the disappearance of Cyrus.
 @>Text: \pgCelebi is discovered in the Ilex Forest, as it took the 'to-be champion' of Johto back in time, rippling space-time.
 @>Text: \pgThey describe the experience as "mind warping".
 @>Text: \pgCelebi has been spotted over the span of 200 years in the Peskan Region, but it has not been claimed to take any other 'victims' back in time.
 @>Text: \pgAny other appearances of the creation trio, or the manipulation of, have been hinted at in historical paintings and scriptures, but none with enough detail to 
  :    : cover.
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\PN]\pgThe book cuts off at this point...
 @>
: When [No]
 @>
: Branch End
@>Play SE: 'GUI storage put down', 80, 100
@>Text: You put the book back.
@>
